column1: back of a length at off stump, defended down the pitch off the back foot
length and some late swing into the pads. Hurriedly brings a closed face down at it and tickles it through midwicket
good length just outside off, tapped to mid-off on the up
short ball at a leg stump line surprises him and he's forced to drop his front shoulder rapidly to let it go
beats the outside edge as this angles in at off stump, draws him forward and then holds its line to skid past his bat
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length on leg stump, shovelled to deep square off the back foot
good length on off stump, goes deep in the crease and blocks on the back foot
short of a length just outside off, sliced to backward point...whose demon lob clears the keeper and gives them an overthrow at midwicket
back of a length and skidding into the stumps. Punched to midwicket off the back foot
short of a length and in at leg stump, cops it on the thigh guard as he looks to glance
good length outside off, inside edge on the forward defence
bouncer at a leg stump line, he's forced to duck again. With his bat hanging up
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length on the thigh and whipped to fine leg
good length with some shape down leg side. Can't get bat on the flick
back of a length at off stump, tapped to mid-off on the up
offcutter at a length, pushed outside off. Thinks about the drive and withdraws
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length on the pads, swipes across the line and loses control on the bat. Looks it has lobbed off his thigh to short fine's left but the umpire reckons there's bat/glove
back of a length on leg stump, punched to mid-on off the back foot
short of a length and in at leg stump. Gets deep in the crease and tickles it past short fine where Stanikzai is positioned. He's still no 100% and won't cut this off
back of a length at middle stump, punched back to the bowler off the back foot
googly, short and wide outside off. Makes too much room for the cut and is beaten
short of a length just outside off. Throws his hands at it, possibly looking to go through off side. But he's early on it and it thumps the inside half and flies past the non-striker
offcutter on a good length at off stump, opens the face and defends into the covers
length ball slanted across off stump, backs away and slashes at it away from the body. Beaten
offcutter at a length outside off, looks to punch through the line but toe-ends it wide of mid-off
short of a length in the corridor, strikes him high on the pad as he shoulders arm. He's struck outside the line as it angles away and there's height on this. Not out says the umpire
good length and in the corridor, left alone

cover point runs backwards, wobbles, and then dives to his left to hold on to this. Sharafuddin the fielder. Superb catch. Mujeeb tosses this up at off stump and Gayle is looking to go over midwicket with the angle. The ball straightens though and he gets a leading edge that hangs high over cover
googly down leg side. Backs away to try and pull but he's beaten down leg side
length outside off, driven on the rise to cover
length ball on leg stump. Looks to get under it for the sweep but deflects it to short fine off the pad
back of a length at off stump, punched to extra cover off the back foot
good length on off stump, pushed to cover off the back foot
short and wide outside off, can't get bat as he slashes at this
short of a length just outside off with some lift off the surface. Left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot

is that an outside edge? Certainly sounded like it! Not out says the umpire. This will be interesting on the replay. Short of a length ball outside off and he looks to punch it through cover...replays suggest it's the right decision.
short of a length on off stump, tapped into the covers off the back foot
oh well bowled. Bouncer aimed right at the helmet and the batsman is forced onto the floor as he looks to get under this
short of a length and thudding into the pad with some nip off the pitch. He was looking to glance that
inside edge onto boot as he reaches out a long way to drive through the covers on the up. Misses the stumps by some way though
short of a length on off stump, blocked off the back foot
length on middle stump, pushed through midwicket off the back foot
tossed up outside off, mistimed drive back to the bowler off the front foot
back of a length on leg stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
short and wide outside off, he's still on the move as he cut this. Not properly timed but it teases the fielder and eventually beats his attempt to keep it in with his boot
good length and shaped away outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, nicely punched off the back foot but Sharaf puts in a big dive to his right and stops with one hand
short of a length outside off, steered to third man's right
good length on middle stump, pushed to mid-on on the up
short of a length on off stump, lifts off the surface and gets the outside half of the bat as he looks to defend
well played. Allows this full ball to swing into him at off stump and opens the face during contact to drill it past mid-off
good length on leg stump, pushed to long-on from the crease
short of a length outside off and he jumps onto the back foot quickly for a neat punch in front of cover
full and into the pads, gets low quickly and swats it between square leg and short fine. That's a poor line and length
short ball on middle stump, backs away and pulls straight to mid-on
dropped short outside off, plenty of room for the cut and he places it past cover again. Nice high elbow and full use of the time and room he had
googly tossed up down leg side, looks to whip it behind square but cops it on the pad
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
oh yes! What a shot that is! The perfect connection as Hope gets behind this length ball outside off and clubs through the line to send it high over the wide long-on region
back of a length just outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
short of a length outside off, steered to third man off the outside half
short ball outside off, he swipes from underneath it and gets a thick outside edge that lands short of third man. The batsman, bizarrely, are both ball-watching. They haven't taken a run...
he retains strike and he's gone next ball. A loose shot. Length ball wide outside off with some lift. He looks to thump it through cover on the up and gets a healthy edge through to the keeper
good length on middle stump, pushed to short midwicket off the front foot
short of a length and in at off stump. Steered to short third man's right off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length outside off, pushed through cover off the front foot
length outside off, pushed to mid-off's right on the front foot
length on leg stump, nudged wide of midwicket off the back foot
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on middle stump, leading edge down the pitch as he closes the face on this
good length on leg stump, pushed wide of midwicket on the up
good length on off stump, defended off the sticker of the bat on the front foot
length on middle stump, pushed to long-on from the front foot
good length outside off, dabbed towards point off the front foot
short of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length and in at off stump. Defended off the back foot
back of a length on middle stump, nudged on the up to mid-on
length and wide outside off. Slapped on the up to extra cover who stops to his right
short and in at leg stump. Wafts it along the floor to fine leg's right
short of a length outside off, tapped to extra cover's right on the up
good length on leg stump, pushed towards long-on, impeded by the midwicket fielder
length on off stump. Looks to drive on the up, gets it to deep midwicket off the inside half
tossed up at off, driven to long-off
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length on leg stump, nudged to midwicket on the up
full on off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
slower ball at a length, just outside off. Inside edge as he looks to drive through the line. It lands well short of the keeper
short of a length wide outside off, under-edges the cut
short of a length outside off, pulls aerially towards mid-on
short and wide outside off, allows it to come on this time and places the square cut to beat point to his left and third man to his right
pumped! What a shot. Short ball in the corridor and he gets onto his toes quickly to get under this and pummel it over midwicket with a pull
floats up a non-turner outside off and Hope slaps it out to sweeper cover
length ball, waits for it to turn and then defends into the off side
pitched up on middle, driven back
back of a length, little spin away, waits and cuts to point
short of a length, cuts to sweeper cover
full and sliding on leg, clipped to midwicket
short ball, gets under it as it goes over middle and leg

ah, what a dolly to get out to! Really, he had all of the leg side field to slam that through and he picks short midwicket like he's giving him a free practice session. A slower short one, a little too wide outside off, so he had to fetch his pull. He wouldn't be too proud with the placement there
shortish and slow at 123ks, wide outside off, chops a cut to cover
slower full one at 122kmph, presses forward and drives into the off side
full and wide, driven to cover who dives and stops it
just back of a length, holding its line outside off, left alone
slid in towards of, presses forward and pushes off the inside of the bat

in the aiir, safe. Curves into him from outside off, and he's really cramped for room. He still backs himself to clear the front leg and loft it over. But he can't swing his arms freely and the ball just about evades the two fielders giving it chase at long-on
defended down the pitch off the front foot
full on off, driven to long-off
flattish length ball, curving in towards off, blocked
fullish on middle and leg, turned away to the on side
short of a length, punched off the backfoot to the right of point
full and drifting outside leg, clipped through backward square leg
full  outside off, driven to cover
slow, dipping low full toss, well-played by Hetmyer who uses the angle and brings the bat down to flick powerfully through midwicket
full outside off, chases and gets an outside edge to third man
swings around for a powerful pull and gets a bottom edge to the pad
fullish around leg, shifts back and keeps it out
short and drifting across, holds its line and he cuts to cover
now he sprays it on leg stump and it's too full, allowing him to clip it away easily off the pads through fine leg
short, spinning in towards off, backs away and cuts through point
full around off, drilled to long-on
fullish and flat on middle and leg, tucked to square leg
full, sliding towards middle, defended off the front foot
advances down the ground and smothers the turn
full, wide, driven to cover
comes down the track and flicks to midwicket
short, straightening outside off, backs away and forces a cut, gets an outside edge through third man
presses forward and opens up to the width on offer to slash to point
full on off, eases into a push through the covers
short of a length, turns sightly towards off, shifts back and punches down the ground
shifts back to a length ball and then haphazardly sticks the bat out to get beaten as it spins back in
full, clipped off the pads through square leg

100th ODI wicket for Rashid! The fastest. That looks tight, the umpire took a long time before raising his finger but this seems pretty close. It was a shortish delivery, sliding towards leg. Hope shaped to pull but it's the wrong'un and strikes him around the leg-stump region.
full, comes forward and blocks

advances down the ground ad drives in the air. Just about evades cover, but hang on! Has ther ebeen a run out here? Yes, he's well out! Oh, jeez, this is terrible. Hetmyer comes down the track and drives through the cover. They cover the first two runs comfortably. They are initially jogging and then pick up speed after deciding late to go for the third. Hetmyer calls, then bails out with Holder halfway down. Too late for the captain to make it back
no feet as he fishes at one outside off and gets beaten
pitched up outside off, zero turn, pushed towards the bowler
short and spinning into his off-stump, backs away and cuts to cover
comes forward and flicks to midwicket
another wrong'un, beats the attempted pull and hits the pad. But it's pitched miles outside leg
fast and full towards leg, gets down for a slog sweep and gets an inside edge through fine leg
full on off, clipped through midwicket
non-turning fullish length delivery, comes forward and defends off the outside of the bat
dead straight outside off and beats the outside edge as he plays for the turn
full around off, driven back
full on middle, driven to the bowler
length ball around off, blocked off the front foot
full and accurate around off, pushed back
full and flat outside off, driven back
shifts back and blocks a back of a length delivery
full outside off, driven to cover
shuffles across and lets it go
slider on leg, beats the flick and hits the pad. Optimistic appeal, turned down. Missing leg comfortably
wrong'un, spinning into the pads and hits the top of the front pad as he shifts back and tries to tuck
full, driven to cover
full and curving on middle, clipped through midwicket
another huge shout. Just brushed the right thigh as it kicks up from a back of a length. Too, way too high
full on leg, clipped through square leg
short of a length, shuffles and punches back from outside off
full on middle and leg eased down to long-on
full on the stumps, defended off the inside of the bat to the on side
blocked off the front foot to the left of the bowler
shifts back to a short of a length delivery and gets hit high on the back pad as he tries to punch
gets down for a big slog and miscues it to wide long-on as he plays it from outside off
shifts back and tucks this shortish delivery but it stops a little and he chips it in the air. Safe, though, as it lands safely
full on the stumps, driven down the pitch
back of a length, punched through the covers
non-turning length ball, punched to midwicket
not enough room, but more than enough power. Brute force as he clears the front leg and hacks this fuller one over long-on
this one again seems like a mishit but it has enough in it to go all the way. Clears the front leg and backs himself to loft it over but he skews it off the outside of the bat. Still carries
full on the stumps, blocked
full, eased down to long-on
length ball, flicked to midwicket
length ball outside off, driven through point
short of a length, backs away and taps to point
advances down the ground and meets the pitch before creaming it over wide of long-on
length ball, comes down the track and then is forced to block
short, wide, backs away and slaps to sweeper cover
presses forward to a fuller one and drives it to the bowler
short of a length, tucked off the hips through square leg
sticks the bat out to a wide one that doesn't spin in and gets beaten
again, shuffles across and then gets the bat slightly inside the line after seeing that it downright refuses to turn
short of a length, punched to the bowler off the backfoot
short of a length, comes on at knee height and he pulls to deep square leg
presses forward to a wide delivery and skews it to short third man off the outside of the bat
short, wide, he's rushed into a cut as it spins in and he chops it to backward point
back of a length, drags a pull to midwicket as it keeps a little low

has he nicked off here? Oh, yes, he has! A slider, pushed across outside his off-stump and he dares to flick against the turn, gets an outside edge to the keeper. Just a feather, well-spotted by the umpire
sliding fuller one, blocked
full outside off, driven to cover

flighted outside off, heaves it through midwicket, past the diving fielder. Najibullah at the deep runs to his right and slides down to pull it back with his right hand but inadvertently makes contact with the rope
length on off, blocked
gets down for a big slog and gets an inside edge to square leg
full, spinning in on off, blocked
flighted outside off, driven off the inside of the bat to the bowler
full on middle and leg, clipped through square leg
looped up on middle and leg, driven to long-on
that's humongous. That's been deposited on the roof. Brathwaite gets right underneath this delivery looped up around off and hacks it straight over with a brutish swing of the arms
full and sliding on leg, driven to long-on
short of a length outside off, defended off the backfoot
full on leg, clipped away to midwicket
beaten on the outside edge as he pushes to defend on the back foot. That ripped away off the surface
length outside off, draws him forward and beats him again on the outside edge
swatted away. Doesn't allow the ball to turn this time, plants a big stride to get to the pitch outside off and lifts it over midwicket
yorker length on middle, jammed down to long-on
slider, back of a length and in at leg stump. Thuds him on the thigh guard as he looks to whip it
full outside off, driven to extra cover's left
back of a length at leg stump, tapped to midwicket on the up
short of a length outside off, tapped to midwicket's left
floated up outside off, driven to long-on
googly at a good length on off stump. Inside edge as he presses forward at this
full at middle stump, flicked straight to midwicket
googly at middle stump, flicked to long-on
length and in at leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket
full and tailing in late at leg stump. Looks to go straight over the bowler but ends up dragging it wide of mid-on off the inside half
short of a length in the corridor, dropped behind point with soft hands

slices to mid-off. Brathwaite's aggressive approach ends up costing him. This is a short of a length ball on off stump and he wants to slap it over midwicket. But it skids on faster than he has anticipated and he gets it off the high part of the bat. It's a simple catch in the end
good length at off stump, tapped into the covers off the front foot
slower bouncer rises above the batsman as he ducks under it
good length outside off, clipped to deep square off the front foot
good length outside off, tapped through covers off the front foot
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
googly pushed through outside off. Taps it to short third man who fields and unleashes a monster throw to break the stumps at the non-striker's end. He's made his ground though
back of a length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
full outside off, defended on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, steered to third man off the outside half
short and in at the ribs. Swivels to pull this out towards fine leg
short outside off, he looks to dab it to third man but that climbs above his bat
short and in the corridor, guided to third man off the under-edge

bisects deep square and fine leg with a top-edged hook. Those fielders are both some way in at the boundaries and both running backwards in the end. He wasn't in control of this shot, dragging it from wide outside off
slower short ball arrives very late as he waits on the back foot to defend
back of a length outside off, punched to long-on off the back foot
full outside off, reaches the pitch with his stride and plays a nicely timed sweep to beat deep square to his right
good length on middle stump, tickled past short fine with a sweep
good length at off stump, dropped in front of point with soft hands
googly, back of a length at middle stump. Punched on the bounce to midwicket's left and his acrobatic effort with his right hand is hampered only by the the uneven bounce
googly at a length on off, defended on the front foot
good length on leg stump, pushed into the leg side off the front foot
length on off stump, defended on the front foot

oh dear that's poor fielding. Looks like Sharaf. West Indies have a mix-up as the batsman pushes in front of midwicket and doesn't respond to the non-striker's call. They're both running to the same end. The fielder swoops in, picks it up and lets rip a thunderous throw at the striker's end that the keeper can't catch. Meanwhile, Nabi has his face in his hands at the other end
length on off stump, pushed to long-off
length on leg stump, pushed behind square off the back foot
length outside off, sliced through point on the up
full on off, defended off the front foot
full at leg stump, pushed into the open midwicket region with soft hands. Sharaf gets to the ball and rotates to throw at the non-striker's end. Misses
short of a length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover's right off the back foot
short of a length outside off, sliced to short third man
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length at middle stump, tapped back to the bowler off the back foot
length ball fired flat and down leg side. Can't get bat on the flick
good length on off stump, tapped to extra cover on the up
good length at middle stump, driven to long-on off the front foot
good length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, closes the face and gets a leading edge to short third man
short of a length outside off, pushed through cover off the back foot
good length and down leg side. Can't connect on the sweep
good length quicker one outside off, leans in and is beaten on the outside edge
tossed up outside off, gets an inside edge onto pad as he looks to play the paddle sweep...or so it appeared. Leg byes says the umpire after turning down the lbw. That hit him outside off
length on middle stump, pushed back down the pitch
full at lg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
good length outside off, defended on the front foot

good length on middle stump, under-edge on the hurried sweep....and a woeful effort at short fine from Dawlat who simply fails to bend down properly at short fine with a one-handed effort to his right
good length outside off, inside edge into square leg as he pushes on the front foot
short of a length outside off, tapped to long-on off the back foot
short of a length googly at leg stump, nudged to short fine
googly and in at middle stump, tapped right in front as he goes on the back foot and looks to whip this. Loud appeal is turned down. That looked really really close
full at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket

loses off stump. An ugly heave from Powell brings a close to an important knock. It's a regulation length ball pushed through flat towards off stump and he completely misses the line as he clears the front leg and swings from middle. It hits the top of off
short of a length and in at leg stump. Deflected to short fine off the thigh guard

trapped in front! Mujeeb has snuck a googly past the inside edge after drawing the batsman forward. He's looking to defend on the front foot and is struck in front of off stump. Not too difficult to give that out
another googly! Roach is drawn in on the front foot as well. He leaves a small gap as well. The fall pitches and rips through the defence to take out off stump
short of a length, holding its line, left alone outside off
good length outside off, pushes away from the body to punch to cover
full, flicked uppishly off the pads through backward square leg
full and slow, pushes early onto the front foot and pushes in the air to cover
short of a length outside off, punched to point
short and wide, left alone outside off
short of good length, jumps back and blocks
shortish, gets up a little more outside off, and he skews his backfoot defence off the top of the bat
short, wide, slashed to point
short, again gets too big on him and he top-edges his pull over the keeper's head
short of a length, jags away a little bit outside off, and he shoulders arms
back of a length around off, jumps and keeps it out towards mid-on
full, curves in and finds the inside of the bat as he drills towards mid-on
short and well outside off, and he can arch back to let it go
gets on top of this back of a length delivery and blocks into the off side
jags away considerably from a short of a good length and finds an outside edge to third man
thumped! A wide half-volley, and he's hacked this straight past the outstretched hands of the bowler
raps him on the pad as it comes in from a short of a length before lobbing away to the off side. Missing leg and too high
shot! A length ball, uses the angle coming into him and chips it over mid-on with a neat punch from the crease. Slightly skewed off the inside of the bat but good enough
131kph outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, jumps and cuts away to point
wayward. Short of a length and skipping down the leg side
back of a length, flicked to the right of mid-on
short of a length on off, jumps and blocks
shortish, waits before opening the face and guiding to third man
full and sprayed on the pads, poor delivery, clipped away over backward square leg
length, too mudh width, left alone
length ball, left alone outside off
length ball on off, blocked
short of a length outside off, gets on top and blocks to point
short of good length around off, jumps and keeps it out to cover
length ball angled in at leg stump, straightening around middle, flicked through midwicket
back of a length, keeps a little low, flicked to square leg
gets on top of a shortish delivery and tries to forcefully play across the line into the leg side but gets no room. Had he missed, the ball would have hit the stumps
jumps and flicks a short one to square leg
shortish, zero room as he looks to pull, misses as the ball gets over off stump
short outside off, jumps and blocks
short, angling into him, swivels and keeps it down as he pulls through midwicket
short of a length, straightens around the fifth-stump channel, left alone
short of good length outside off, jumps and punches to cover
good length, angling in towards off, defended down the pitch
misses a flick and gets hit on the high part of the pad as he jumps
full and clipped to square leg

what sort of a follow-through is that! Flicks a length ball over midwicket and then kicks the backfoot up sideways to his right and holds pose. Like it's some sort of a circus stunt. Boy, this guy never ceases to entertain!
and when you offer up deliveries such as those, it's double the fun. Short, wide, and he slaps it over point
short of a length down the leg side
back of a length, keeps low, jumps and flicks to midwicket
fullish on leg, flicked to midwicket
gets on top of a shortish one and scythes it to point
tucked off the pads to fine leg
short, wide, reaches out and slashes and gets a bottom edge that lands just to the right of Gayle at first slip
back of a length a set of stumps wide, blocked from the crease
huge shout for lbw, not given. Naib walked across and tried to flick but missed and got hit on the pad. May have missed leg stump with that angle
short of a length, shuffles across and blocks
full and wide, too much room, and a big swing of the arms from Shahzad as he thumps it over long-on
full on middle and leg, too easy again as he clips away to deep midwicket. Resounding start for Afghanistan
short and wide, doesn't bounce as much as he swings and misses
length on middle, defended to point with an open face
short, well-directed bouncer as he ducks away

there's the opening they were looking for. He's paid the price for sticking his bat out well away from his body. Shortish, feels for it loosely without getting behind the line and some late away movement results in an outside edge to third man
back of a length, flicked to midwicket
short ball that rushes into him and gets too big on him, pulls hurriedly and luckily for him lands past square leg running back
short, wide, left alone
pushed into the off side off the front foot
length on off, pushed between cover and extra cover
beautifully done. Arches back to evade a short delivery, in fact so far back, that when he ramps it over the keeper, it's closer to the fine leg region. #Flexiblespine
blocked from the crease
short of a length, flicked with the angle to square leg
shuffles across and blocks a length ball
back of a length, flicked from front of middle to deep backward square leg
jumps back and nudges into on side
sticks his bat out at one that gets too big on him outside off, rips past the edge
yorker on off, dug out
back of a length outside off, blocked
backs away to a back of a length delivery and blocks
back of a length on the stumps, jumps and defends
short, wide, slashed to point who gets down to his right and fields
nudged to midwicket
short, rolls his wrists over a pull to deep midwicket
length on middle, blocked
short of a length, defended in front of off
short of a length, backs away and swings and misses
short, wide, again he backs away a long way and ends up skewing off the toe-end to third man
solidly blocked off the backfoot towards extra cover
short, jumps and punches to mid-on
fullish, wide, slashes through extra cover. Wants a second but is sent back
short of a length, flicked to the on side
back of a length, blocked to mid-off
short, not much pace at 128ks, and that allows him to get on top of the bounce and pull it over midwicket
banged in short and angled in, pulled to deep fine leg
another ramp from Shahzad. Short, wide, and he reaches out with an arched back. Third man cuts it off this time though
flicked off the pads to deep fine leg. Fifty for Shahzad. Does the Champion dance to celebrate the milestone
jags away and left alone outside off
back of a length on middle, blocked to midwicket
drills a fuller one to cover
full and turned away to midwicket
angles in a length ball that's flicked through square leg
good length and in at middle stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length outside off, chopped through the open cover region. Evin Lewis gives chase from point and pulls it back in
no stopping this. A full ball wide outside off to Shahzad and he plonks half a stride before crashing this through extra cover
full on middle stump, pushed to long-on off the front foot
short ball climbs up slowly, he swivels to hook along the floor to deep square
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square
short of a length at off stump, punched to mid-on off the back foot
short ball outside off, sliced to point with an open face
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
good length outside off, looks to flick through midwicket and can't connect
full and wide outside off, shuffles and sweeps. Beaten on the under-edge
full outside off, defended on the front foot
yorker outside off, jammed back down the pitch
shot. Full ball outside off, driven past Samuels at cover who looks to be in discomfort - doesn't give chase. Lewis has to do it from point. Nice balance from Rahmat on this
short ball down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
short of a length and in at off stump. Drops it in front of point with soft hands but he can't steal the single
full on the toes, deflected to fine leg with a closed face
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
short ball on middle stump, comfortably steered to fine leg with a hook
short and wide outside off, looks to cut and under-edges into the off side
good length at off, steps out and gets an inside edge onto pad
short of a length on leg stump, whipped to deep square off the back foot
full ball at off stump, shuffles a long way and goes for the reverse sweep from behind him. Gets a glove on it and onto pad
length on leg stump, nudged through square leg from the crease
full at off stump, steps out and flicks to long-on
length outside off, reaches out off the front foot and steers it to third man's left
chips it over mid-off but he has miscued that. Looks to cream this full ball inside-out over extra but he's through the shot early
short ball at off stump, ducks, looks to evade, then changes his mind and swats it away one-handed, with his left hand
slower ball, back of a length at off stump. Defended down the pitch
short and just outside off, chopped to sweeper's left
short ball on off, waits for it to arrive and pulls in front of deep square
short of a length outside off, tapped to extra cover off the back foot
back of a length at middle, pushed to silly mid-on off the back foot
short of a length at leg stump, nudged through square leg off the back foot
full at leg stump, flicked through square leg
short ball down leg side, can't connect with the pull
length ball spins into the pads and hits him as he looks to glance
another short ball down leg and he goes deep in the crease before tickling this fine
low full toss on middle stump, punched to long-on off the front foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
low full toss outside off, driven straight to extra cover
short of a length at leg stump, tapped into the leg side off the back foot
good bouncer, but Rahmat just manages enough bat on it to get it over the keeper. Climbs at him at an off stump line and he's caught rooted to the crease as he takes this on
short of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
full outside off, driven straight to extra cover
tossed up at middle stump, steps out and pokes to short mid-on
back of a length at middle stump, flicked to deep square
back of a length at off stump, punched to extra cover off the back foot
good length outside off, skids onto the pad as he pushes onto the front foot. He's outside the line
short of a length outside off, backs away and cuts towards extra cover
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
edge and over the keeper. Backs away to try and make room against this bouncer. Woeful position as he looks to cut. But it looks like it's his day. This comfortably evades the keeper
yorker at middle stump, jammed into the covers

backs away and this time he manages to get the middle of the bat. Once again, he's not in great position. The short one lifts into him as he moves into the leg side, but he manages to waft and get this over point
short of a length and in at leg stump, pushed to midwicket's right off the back foot
bouncer slants down leg side, he lets it go
full at leg stump, clipped through midwicket
full on off stump, defended on the front foot
full at middle stump, skips down and pushes to long-on
full on middle stump, flicked to deep square
full outside off, expansive drive to sweeper off the front foot
good length outside off, plants the front foot forward and clips to deep square
oh this looks close. Not out says umpire on the lbw appeal. Tossed up wide outside off, looks to sweep and he's yorked. Nurse unhappy but it looks the correct decision
back of a length outside off, tapped to sweeper cover on the up
legcutter, floated full outside off. Looks to lift it over extra cover and is beaten
slower ball, short and wide outside off. Mistimed cut straight to point
short ball outside off, pulled to long-on
short ball outside off, nudged to midwicket off the back foot
short of a length at off stump, punched to mid-on off the back foot
full at off stump, gets behind the line and hoicks it to the midwicket boundary. Ugly heave to full effect. There's no one deep
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
length on leg stump, steps out and flicks to deep square
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
back of a length on middle stump, tapped to short mid-on
length on middle, steps out and flicks to short midwicket
bouncer too steep for him. Can't get away from it this time and is beaten on the periscope ramp
slower ball outside off at a length, defended into the off side
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Opens the face and runs it to third man
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
nicely placed. Short ball at the chest, swivels and nails the hook. Full balance, full control. Gets it wide of fine leg
another bouncer. This one's dug in too short and climbs well above the batsman
back of a length on leg stump, taps it on the up towards mid-on
good length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length on off, blocked down the pitch
good length on leg stump, pushed to short midwicket off the front foot
length on off, nudged back to the bowler off the front foot
length on middle, steps out and flicks to short midwicket
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
tossed up. Right up. That could possibly be in the 50s. And it's short and on the pads. He taps it to short fine
another loopy length ball. Shahzad has time to change his expression from shock to disgust before pushing into the leg side

and he's got him! Oh this is...comical, really. Shahzad is sulking like he's been mankaded after facing bodyline bowling for four hours. But the truth is, it's just extremely slow bowling that has completely suckered him. Another loopy length ball from Gayle. Shahzad lines up, then decides to step out. Yorks himself and chips it straight to mid-off. Gayle is bemused. Shahzad shrugs...then pulls out a big celebration just outside the dressing room that hasn't caught Phil Simmons' imagination...absolute Under-14s stuff this!
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
tossed up on middle stump, driven down to long-on
back of a length on middle stump, punched through mid-on off the back foot
good length at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
tossed up at off stump, driven to long-off
short of a length on leg stump, dabbed through square leg off the back foot
short of a length at middle stump, whipped to deep square off the back foot
length on middle stump, can't get the paddle sweep past short fine
tossed up at off stump, steps out and drives to mid-off
back of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
tossed up on middle stump, driven to long-on
well played. Gayle's keeping it slow so Samiullah has no choice but to completely swing from under this with a sweep. He does it well and lifts it over short fine
length on leg stump, nudged to short fine
full and fast down leg side. Can't get bat on the sweep and keeper can't gather it either
tossed up at off stump, skips down to drive to long-on
length, shifts back and flicks through midwicket
pitched up on off, driven back
short of a length, flat, tucked to fine leg
full outside off, blocked off the front foot
fuller, presses forward and eases it through the cover
length, shuffles and flicks with the turn to backward square leg
flighted on middle and leg, clipped through square leg
length, not much turn, tucked to the on side
gets down and across to sweep but it's not full enough and he mistimes it to short fine leg
leg-side lines again and he flicks to square leg
full outside off, driven down to long-on. Fifty for Rahmat
tossed up outside off, flicked to midwicket
stands tall and punches to long-on
flighted outside off, driven into cover
appeal for lbw, not given. Looped up outside off and beating the flick to spin in, nit the pad and lob towards first slip. Must have spun too much
gets down to sweep from outside off and gets hit on the pad. Impact outside off
shuffles across and blocks a length ball
pitched up on middle and off, clipped to wide long-on

throws it away by needlessly stepping down for a glorious shot. Good innings, nonetheless, but he'd be kicking himself for not finishing it off. Blindly skips down to a flat length ball and doesn't get anywhere close to the pitch. Swings and makes no room, leaving the keeper to complete a straightforward stumping
lots of flight, driven wide of long-on
stays back and flicks this length ball to square leg
pitched up outside off, driven to long-on
floated up outside off, clipped to deep midwicket
jumps up to a short one and blocks to cover
tries to flick a short of a length delivery that drifts down the leg side. No wide signal, so that must have brushed the pad
short, gets too big on him outside off, forcing him to scamper out of the way
full toss, flicked through square leg
short of a length, angles in, jumps and tucks through square leg for a quick second
short, gets on top of the bounce and pats it towards third man with an open face
shifts back and flicks between long-on and deep midwicket. Picked the gap well and equally well-done on coming back for the second
flat length ball, turned away to midwicket
pitched up around leg, driven down to long-on
looped up on middle, dabbed towards midwicket
now he gets down for a big sweep and gets an inside edge onto the pad
lots of flight and dipping late, clipped away
short of a length, attacking the stumps, jumps and blocks
length ball, whipped away to fine leg
length ball, tails in late, Shenwari is sure of his off-stump and leaves confidently
full on the fourth-stump channel, and that's a pristine drive, through the left of extra cover. Perfect placement and brilliantly-timed
length ball, left alone outside off
short, gets on top of the bounce and nudges through square leg
fullish length on leg stump, not quite enough room, and he gets down to sweep without much timing to backward square leg

that's outta here! Nabi hastening Afghanistan's pursuit of victory. Backed away early to xpose all three stumps. Gayle fired it in around leg stump and he stepped down, gave himself more room before whacking it over long-on
goes again, and goes bigger! This one's monstrous and goes, sits on the roof. A length ball that slides towards leg stump and he steps down, gets to the pitch and hammers it straight over

and that's it! Back-to-back sixes to finish this off. Important moment in Afghanistan's history and progression as a top side. Comes down the track and goes big down the ground. Skews it off the outside of the bat but the power on that shot will do
